26// With ASAN on Windows we have to reset the thread-in-wasm flag. Exceptions
27// caused by ASAN let the thread-in-wasm flag get out of sync. Even marking
28// functions with DISABLE_ASAN is not sufficient when the compiler produces
29// calls to memset. Therefore we add test-specific code for ASAN on
30// Windows.
31#define RESET_THREAD_IN_WASM_FLAG_FOR_ASAN_ON_WINDOWS

42using base::WriteUnalignedValue;

44void f32_trunc_wrapper(Address data) {
45 WriteUnalignedValue<float>(data, truncf(ReadUnalignedValue<float>(data)));
46}
47
48void f32_floor_wrapper(Address data) {
49 WriteUnalignedValue<float>(data, floorf(ReadUnalignedValue<float>(data)));
50}
51
52void f32_ceil_wrapper(Address data) {
53 WriteUnalignedValue<float>(data, ceilf(ReadUnalignedValue<float>(data)));
54}

56void f32_nearest_int_wrapper(Address data) {
57 float input = ReadUnalignedValue<float>(data);
58 float value = nearbyintf(input);
59#if V8_OS_AIX
60 value = FpOpWorkaround<float>(input, value);
61#endif
62 WriteUnalignedValue<float>(data, value);
63}

66 WriteUnalignedValue<double>(data, trunc(ReadUnalignedValue<double>(data)));
67}

70 WriteUnalignedValue<double>(data, floor(ReadUnalignedValue<double>(data)));

74 WriteUnalignedValue<double>(data, ceil(ReadUnalignedValue<double>(data)));
75}

77void f64_nearest_int_wrapper(Address data) {
78 double input = ReadUnalignedValue<double>(data);
79 double value = nearbyint(input);
80#if V8_OS_AIX
81 value = FpOpWorkaround<double>(input, value);
82#endif
83 WriteUnalignedValue<double>(data, value);
84}

86void int64_to_float32_wrapper(Address data) {
87 int64_t input = ReadUnalignedValue<int64_t>(data);
88 WriteUnalignedValue<float>(data, static_cast<float>(input));
89}
90
91void uint64_to_float32_wrapper(Address data) {
92 uint64_t input = ReadUnalignedValue<uint64_t>(data);
93#if defined(V8_OS_WIN)
94 // On Windows, the FP stack registers calculate with less precision, which
95 // leads to a uint64_t to float32 conversion which does not satisfy the
96 // WebAssembly specification. Therefore we do a different approach here:
97 //
98 // / leading 0 \/ 24 float data bits \/ for rounding \/ trailing 0 \
99 // 00000000000001XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX100000000000000
100 //
101 // Float32 can only represent 24 data bit (1 implicit 1 bit + 23 mantissa
102 // bits). Starting from the most significant 1 bit, we can therefore extract
103 // 24 bits and do the conversion only on them. The other bits can affect the
104 // result only through rounding. Rounding works as follows:
105 // * If the most significant rounding bit is not set, then round down.
106 // * If the most significant rounding bit is set, and at least one of the
107 // other rounding bits is set, then round up.
108 // * If the most significant rounding bit is set, but all other rounding bits
109 // are not set, then round to even.
110 // We can aggregate 'all other rounding bits' in the second-most significant
111 // rounding bit.
112 // The resulting algorithm is therefore as follows:
113 // * Check if the distance between the most significant bit (MSB) and the
114 // least significant bit (LSB) is greater than 25 bits. If the distance is
115 // less or equal to 25 bits, the uint64 to float32 conversion is anyways
116 // exact, and we just use the C++ conversion.
117 // * Find the most significant bit (MSB).
118 // * Starting from the MSB, extract 25 bits (24 data bits + the first rounding
119 // bit).
120 // * The remaining rounding bits are guaranteed to contain at least one 1 bit,
121 // due to the check we did above.
122 // * Store the 25 bits + 1 aggregated bit in an uint32_t.
123 // * Convert this uint32_t to float. The conversion does the correct rounding
124 // now.
125 // * Shift the result back to the original magnitude.
126 uint32_t leading_zeros = base::bits::CountLeadingZeros(input);
127 uint32_t trailing_zeros = base::bits::CountTrailingZeros(input);
128 constexpr uint32_t num_extracted_bits = 25;
129 // Check if there are any rounding bits we have to aggregate.
130 if (leading_zeros + trailing_zeros + num_extracted_bits < 64) {
131 // Shift to extract the data bits.
132 uint32_t num_aggregation_bits = 64 - num_extracted_bits - leading_zeros;
133 // We extract the bits we want to convert. Note that we convert one bit more
134 // than necessary. This bit is a placeholder where we will store the
135 // aggregation bit.
136 int32_t extracted_bits =
137 static_cast<int32_t>(input >> (num_aggregation_bits - 1));
138 // Set the aggregation bit. We don't have to clear the slot first, because
139 // the bit there is also part of the aggregation.
140 extracted_bits |= 1;
141 float result = static_cast<float>(extracted_bits);
142 // We have to shift the result back. The shift amount is
143 // (num_aggregation_bits - 1), which is the shift amount we did originally,
144 // and (-2), which is for the two additional bits we kept originally for
145 // rounding.
146 int32_t shift_back = static_cast<int32_t>(num_aggregation_bits) - 1 - 2;
147 // Calculate the multiplier to shift the extracted bits back to the original
148 // magnitude. This multiplier is a power of two, so in the float32 bit
149 // representation we just have to construct the correct exponent and put it
150 // at the correct bit offset. The exponent consists of 8 bits, starting at
151 // the second MSB (a.k.a '<< 23'). The encoded exponent itself is
152 // ('actual exponent' - 127).
153 int32_t multiplier_bits = ((shift_back - 127) & 0xff) << 23;
154 result *= base::bit_cast<float>(multiplier_bits);
155 WriteUnalignedValue<float>(data, result);
156 return;
157 }
158#endif // defined(V8_OS_WIN)
159 WriteUnalignedValue<float>(data, static_cast<float>(input));
160}
161
162void int64_to_float64_wrapper(Address data) {
163 int64_t input = ReadUnalignedValue<int64_t>(data);
164 WriteUnalignedValue<double>(data, static_cast<double>(input));
165}
166
167void uint64_to_float64_wrapper(Address data) {
168 uint64_t input = ReadUnalignedValue<uint64_t>(data);
169 double result = static_cast<double>(input);
170
171#if V8_CC_MSVC
172 // With MSVC we use static_cast<double>(uint32_t) instead of
173 // static_cast<double>(uint64_t) to achieve round-to-nearest-ties-even
174 // semantics. The idea is to calculate
175 // static_cast<double>(high_word) * 2^32 + static_cast<double>(low_word).
176 uint32_t low_word = static_cast<uint32_t>(input & 0xFFFFFFFF);
177 uint32_t high_word = static_cast<uint32_t>(input >> 32);
178
179 double shift = static_cast<double>(1ull << 32);
180
181 result = static_cast<double>(high_word);
182 result *= shift;
183 result += static_cast<double>(low_word);
184#endif
185
186 WriteUnalignedValue<double>(data, result);
187}
188
189int32_t float32_to_int64_wrapper(Address data) {
190 float input = ReadUnalignedValue<float>(data);
191 if (base::IsValueInRangeForNumericType<int64_t>(input)) {
192 WriteUnalignedValue<int64_t>(data, static_cast<int64_t>(input));
193 return 1;
194 }
195 return 0;
196}
197
198int32_t float32_to_uint64_wrapper(Address data) {
199 float input = ReadUnalignedValue<float>(data);
200 if (base::IsValueInRangeForNumericType<uint64_t>(input)) {
201 WriteUnalignedValue<uint64_t>(data, static_cast<uint64_t>(input));
202 return 1;
203 }
204 return 0;
205}
206
207int32_t float64_to_int64_wrapper(Address data) {
208 double input = ReadUnalignedValue<double>(data);
209 if (base::IsValueInRangeForNumericType<int64_t>(input)) {
210 WriteUnalignedValue<int64_t>(data, static_cast<int64_t>(input));
211 return 1;
212 }
213 return 0;
214}
215
216int32_t float64_to_uint64_wrapper(Address data) {
217 double input = ReadUnalignedValue<double>(data);
218 if (base::IsValueInRangeForNumericType<uint64_t>(input)) {
219 WriteUnalignedValue<uint64_t>(data, static_cast<uint64_t>(input));
220 return 1;
221 }
222 return 0;
223}
224
225void float32_to_int64_sat_wrapper(Address data) {
226 float input = ReadUnalignedValue<float>(data);
227 if (base::IsValueInRangeForNumericType<int64_t>(input)) {
228 WriteUnalignedValue<int64_t>(data, static_cast<int64_t>(input));
229 return;
230 }
231 if (std::isnan(input)) {
232 WriteUnalignedValue<int64_t>(data, 0);
233 return;
234 }
235 if (input < 0.0) {
236 WriteUnalignedValue<int64_t>(data, std::numeric_limits<int64_t>::min());
237 return;
238 }
239 WriteUnalignedValue<int64_t>(data, std::numeric_limits<int64_t>::max());
240}
241
242void float32_to_uint64_sat_wrapper(Address data) {
243 float input = ReadUnalignedValue<float>(data);
244 if (base::IsValueInRangeForNumericType<uint64_t>(input)) {
245 WriteUnalignedValue<uint64_t>(data, static_cast<uint64_t>(input));
246 return;
247 }
248 if (input >= static_cast<float>(std::numeric_limits<uint64_t>::max())) {
249 WriteUnalignedValue<uint64_t>(data, std::numeric_limits<uint64_t>::max());
250 return;
251 }
252 WriteUnalignedValue<uint64_t>(data, 0);
253}
254
255void float64_to_int64_sat_wrapper(Address data) {
256 double input = ReadUnalignedValue<double>(data);
257 if (base::IsValueInRangeForNumericType<int64_t>(input)) {
258 WriteUnalignedValue<int64_t>(data, static_cast<int64_t>(input));
259 return;
260 }
261 if (std::isnan(input)) {
262 WriteUnalignedValue<int64_t>(data, 0);
263 return;
264 }
265 if (input < 0.0) {
266 WriteUnalignedValue<int64_t>(data, std::numeric_limits<int64_t>::min());
267 return;
268 }
269 WriteUnalignedValue<int64_t>(data, std::numeric_limits<int64_t>::max());
270}
271
272void float64_to_uint64_sat_wrapper(Address data) {
273 double input = ReadUnalignedValue<double>(data);
274 if (base::IsValueInRangeForNumericType<uint64_t>(input)) {
275 WriteUnalignedValue<uint64_t>(data, static_cast<uint64_t>(input));
276 return;
277 }
278 if (input >= static_cast<double>(std::numeric_limits<uint64_t>::max())) {
279 WriteUnalignedValue<uint64_t>(data, std::numeric_limits<uint64_t>::max());
280 return;
281 }
282 WriteUnalignedValue<uint64_t>(data, 0);
283}
284
285int32_t int64_div_wrapper(Address data) {
286 int64_t dividend = ReadUnalignedValue<int64_t>(data);
287 int64_t divisor = ReadUnalignedValue<int64_t>(data + sizeof(dividend));
288 if (divisor == 0) {
289 return 0;
290 }
291 if (divisor == -1 && dividend == std::numeric_limits<int64_t>::min()) {
292 return -1;
293 }
294 WriteUnalignedValue<int64_t>(data, dividend / divisor);
295 return 1;
296}
297
298int32_t int64_mod_wrapper(Address data) {
299 int64_t dividend = ReadUnalignedValue<int64_t>(data);
300 int64_t divisor = ReadUnalignedValue<int64_t>(data + sizeof(dividend));
301 if (divisor == 0) {
302 return 0;
303 }
304 if (divisor == -1 && dividend == std::numeric_limits<int64_t>::min()) {
305 WriteUnalignedValue<int64_t>(data, 0);
306 return 1;
307 }
308 WriteUnalignedValue<int64_t>(data, dividend % divisor);
309 return 1;
310}
311
312int32_t uint64_div_wrapper(Address data) {
313 uint64_t dividend = ReadUnalignedValue<uint64_t>(data);
314 uint64_t divisor = ReadUnalignedValue<uint64_t>(data + sizeof(dividend));
315 if (divisor == 0) {
316 return 0;
317 }
318 WriteUnalignedValue<uint64_t>(data, dividend / divisor);
319 return 1;
320}
321
322int32_t uint64_mod_wrapper(Address data) {
323 uint64_t dividend = ReadUnalignedValue<uint64_t>(data);
324 uint64_t divisor = ReadUnalignedValue<uint64_t>(data + sizeof(dividend));
325 if (divisor == 0) {
326 return 0;
327 }
328 WriteUnalignedValue<uint64_t>(data, dividend % divisor);
329 return 1;
330}
331
332uint32_t word32_rol_wrapper(uint32_t input, uint32_t shift) {
333 return (input << (shift & 31)) | (input >> ((32 - shift) & 31));
334}
335
336uint32_t word32_ror_wrapper(uint32_t input, uint32_t shift) {
337 return (input >> (shift & 31)) | (input << ((32 - shift) & 31));
338}
339
340uint64_t word64_rol_wrapper(uint64_t input, uint32_t shift) {
341 return (input << (shift & 63)) | (input >> ((64 - shift) & 63));
342}
343
344uint64_t word64_ror_wrapper(uint64_t input, uint32_t shift) {
345 return (input >> (shift & 63)) | (input << ((64 - shift) & 63));
346}
347
348void float64_pow_wrapper(Address data) {
349 double x = ReadUnalignedValue<double>(data);
350 double y = ReadUnalignedValue<double>(data + sizeof(x));
351 WriteUnalignedValue<double>(data, base::ieee754::pow(x, y));
352}
353
354template <typename T, T (*float_round_op)(T)>
355void simd_float_round_wrapper(Address data) {
356 constexpr int n = kSimd128Size / sizeof(T);
357 for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
358 T input = ReadUnalignedValue<T>(data + (i * sizeof(T)));
359 T value = float_round_op(input);
360#if V8_OS_AIX
361 value = FpOpWorkaround<T>(input, value);
362#endif
363 WriteUnalignedValue<T>(data + (i * sizeof(T)), value);
364 }
365}
366
367void f64x2_ceil_wrapper(Address data) {
368 simd_float_round_wrapper<double, &ceil>(data);
369}
370
371void f64x2_floor_wrapper(Address data) {
372 simd_float_round_wrapper<double, &floor>(data);
373}

375void f64x2_trunc_wrapper(Address data) {
376 simd_float_round_wrapper<double, &trunc>(data);
377}
378
379void f64x2_nearest_int_wrapper(Address data) {
380 simd_float_round_wrapper<double, &nearbyint>(data);
381}

384 simd_float_round_wrapper<float, &ceilf>(data);
385}
386
387void f32x4_floor_wrapper(Address data) {
388 simd_float_round_wrapper<float, &floorf>(data);
389}

391void f32x4_trunc_wrapper(Address data) {
392 simd_float_round_wrapper<float, &truncf>(data);
393}
394
395void f32x4_nearest_int_wrapper(Address data) {
396 simd_float_round_wrapper<float, &nearbyintf>(data);
397}

399namespace {
400class V8_NODISCARD ThreadNotInWasmScope {
401// Asan on Windows triggers exceptions to allocate shadow memory lazily. When
402// this function is called from WebAssembly, these exceptions would be handled
403// by the trap handler before they get handled by Asan, and thereby confuse the
404// thread-in-wasm flag. Therefore we disable ASAN for this function.
405// Alternatively we could reset the thread-in-wasm flag before calling this
406// function. However, as this is only a problem with Asan on Windows, we did not
407// consider it worth the overhead.
408#if defined(RESET_THREAD_IN_WASM_FLAG_FOR_ASAN_ON_WINDOWS)
409
410 public:
411 ThreadNotInWasmScope() : thread_was_in_wasm_(trap_handler::IsThreadInWasm()) {
412 if (thread_was_in_wasm_) {
413 trap_handler::ClearThreadInWasm();
414 }
415 }
416
417 ~ThreadNotInWasmScope() {
418 if (thread_was_in_wasm_) {
419 trap_handler::SetThreadInWasm();
420 }
421 }
422
423 private:
424 bool thread_was_in_wasm_;
425#else
426
427 public:
428 ThreadNotInWasmScope() {
429 // This is needed to avoid compilation errors (unused variable).
430 USE(this);
431 }
432#endif
433};
434
435inline uint8_t* EffectiveAddress(Tagged<WasmTrustedInstanceData> trusted_data,
436 uint32_t mem_index, uintptr_t index) {
437 return trusted_data->memory_base(mem_index) + index;
438}
439
440template <typename V>
441V ReadAndIncrementOffset(Address data, size_t* offset) {
442 V result = ReadUnalignedValue<V>(data + *offset);
443 *offset += sizeof(V);
444 return result;
445}
446
447constexpr int32_t kSuccess = 1;
448constexpr int32_t kOutOfBounds = 0;
449} // namespace
450
451int32_t memory_init_wrapper(Address trusted_data_addr, uint32_t mem_index,
452 uintptr_t dst, uint32_t src, uint32_t seg_index,
453 uint32_t size) {
454 ThreadNotInWasmScope thread_not_in_wasm_scope;
455 DisallowGarbageCollection no_gc;
456 Tagged<WasmTrustedInstanceData> trusted_data =
457 Tagged<WasmTrustedInstanceData>::cast(Tagged<Object>{trusted_data_addr});
458
459 uint64_t mem_size = trusted_data->memory_size(mem_index);
460 if (!base::IsInBounds<uint64_t>(dst, size, mem_size)) return kOutOfBounds;
461
462 uint32_t seg_size = trusted_data->data_segment_sizes()->get(seg_index);
463 if (!base::IsInBounds<uint32_t>(src, size, seg_size)) return kOutOfBounds;
464
465 uint8_t* seg_start = reinterpret_cast<uint8_t*>(
466 trusted_data->data_segment_starts()->get(seg_index));
467 std::memcpy(EffectiveAddress(trusted_data, mem_index, dst), seg_start + src,
468 size);
469 return kSuccess;
470}
471
472int32_t memory_copy_wrapper(Address trusted_data_addr, uint32_t dst_mem_index,
473 uint32_t src_mem_index, uintptr_t dst,
474 uintptr_t src, uintptr_t size) {
475 ThreadNotInWasmScope thread_not_in_wasm_scope;
476 DisallowGarbageCollection no_gc;
477 Tagged<WasmTrustedInstanceData> trusted_data =
478 Tagged<WasmTrustedInstanceData>::cast(Tagged<Object>{trusted_data_addr});
479
480 uint64_t dst_mem_size = trusted_data->memory_size(dst_mem_index);
481 uint64_t src_mem_size = trusted_data->memory_size(src_mem_index);
482 if (!base::IsInBounds<uint64_t>(dst, size, dst_mem_size)) return kOutOfBounds;
483 if (!base::IsInBounds<uint64_t>(src, size, src_mem_size)) return kOutOfBounds;
484
485 // Use std::memmove, because the ranges can overlap.
486 std::memmove(EffectiveAddress(trusted_data, dst_mem_index, dst),
487 EffectiveAddress(trusted_data, src_mem_index, src), size);
488 return kSuccess;
489}
490
491int32_t memory_fill_wrapper(Address trusted_data_addr, uint32_t mem_index,
492 uintptr_t dst, uint8_t value, uintptr_t size) {
493 ThreadNotInWasmScope thread_not_in_wasm_scope;
494 DisallowGarbageCollection no_gc;
495
496 Tagged<WasmTrustedInstanceData> trusted_data =
497 Tagged<WasmTrustedInstanceData>::cast(Tagged<Object>{trusted_data_addr});
498
499 uint64_t mem_size = trusted_data->memory_size(mem_index);
500 if (!base::IsInBounds<uint64_t>(dst, size, mem_size)) return kOutOfBounds;
501
502 std::memset(EffectiveAddress(trusted_data, mem_index, dst), value, size);
503 return kSuccess;
504}
505
506namespace {
507inline void* ArrayElementAddress(Address array, uint32_t index,
508 int element_size_bytes) {
509 return reinterpret_cast<void*>(array + WasmArray::kHeaderSize -
510 kHeapObjectTag + index * element_size_bytes);
511}
512inline void* ArrayElementAddress(Tagged<WasmArray> array, uint32_t index,
513 int element_size_bytes) {
514 return ArrayElementAddress(array.ptr(), index, element_size_bytes);
515}
516} // namespace
517
518void array_copy_wrapper(Address raw_dst_array, uint32_t dst_index,
519 Address raw_src_array, uint32_t src_index,
520 uint32_t length) {
521 DCHECK_GT(length, 0);
522 ThreadNotInWasmScope thread_not_in_wasm_scope;
523 DisallowGarbageCollection no_gc;
524 Tagged<WasmArray> dst_array = WasmArray::cast(Tagged<Object>(raw_dst_array));
525 Tagged<WasmArray> src_array = WasmArray::cast(Tagged<Object>(raw_src_array));
526
527 bool overlapping_ranges =
528 dst_array.ptr() == src_array.ptr() &&
529 (dst_index < src_index ? dst_index + length > src_index
530 : src_index + length > dst_index);
531 wasm::ValueType element_type = src_array->type()->element_type();
532 if (element_type.is_reference()) {
533 ObjectSlot dst_slot = dst_array->ElementSlot(dst_index);
534 ObjectSlot src_slot = src_array->ElementSlot(src_index);
535 Heap* heap = dst_array->GetIsolate()->heap();
536 if (overlapping_ranges) {
537 heap->MoveRange(dst_array, dst_slot, src_slot, length,
538 UPDATE_WRITE_BARRIER);
539 } else {
540 heap->CopyRange(dst_array, dst_slot, src_slot, length,
541 UPDATE_WRITE_BARRIER);
542 }
543 } else {
544 int element_size_bytes = element_type.value_kind_size();
545 void* dst = ArrayElementAddress(dst_array, dst_index, element_size_bytes);
546 void* src = ArrayElementAddress(src_array, src_index, element_size_bytes);
547 size_t copy_size = length * element_size_bytes;
548 if (overlapping_ranges) {
549 MemMove(dst, src, copy_size);
550 } else {
551 MemCopy(dst, src, copy_size);
552 }
553 }
554}
555
556void array_fill_wrapper(Address raw_array, uint32_t index, uint32_t length,
557 uint32_t emit_write_barrier, uint32_t raw_type,
558 Address initial_value_addr) {
559 ThreadNotInWasmScope thread_not_in_wasm_scope;
560 DisallowGarbageCollection no_gc;
561 ValueType type = ValueType::FromRawBitField(raw_type);
562 int8_t* initial_element_address = reinterpret_cast<int8_t*>(
563 ArrayElementAddress(raw_array, index, type.value_kind_size()));
564 // Stack pointers are only aligned to 4 bytes.
565 int64_t initial_value = base::ReadUnalignedValue<int64_t>(initial_value_addr);
566 const int bytes_to_set = length * type.value_kind_size();
567
568 // If the initial value is zero, we memset the array.
569 if (type.is_numeric() && initial_value == 0) {
570 std::memset(initial_element_address, 0, bytes_to_set);
571 return;
572 }
573
574 // We implement the general case by setting the first 8 bytes manually, then
575 // filling the rest by exponentially growing {memcpy}s.
576
577 DCHECK_GE(static_cast<size_t>(bytes_to_set), sizeof(int64_t));
578
579 switch (type.kind()) {
580 case kI64:
581 case kF64: {
582 // Array elements are only aligned to 4 bytes, therefore
583 // `initial_element_address` may be misaligned as a 64-bit pointer.
584 base::WriteUnalignedValue<int64_t>(
585 reinterpret_cast<Address>(initial_element_address), initial_value);
586 break;
587 }
588 case kI32:
589 case kF32: {
590 int32_t* base = reinterpret_cast<int32_t*>(initial_element_address);
591 base[0] = base[1] = static_cast<int32_t>(initial_value);
592 break;
593 }
594 case kI16: {
595 int16_t* base = reinterpret_cast<int16_t*>(initial_element_address);
596 base[0] = base[1] = base[2] = base[3] =
597 static_cast<int16_t>(initial_value);
598 break;
599 }
600 case kI8: {
601 int8_t* base = reinterpret_cast<int8_t*>(initial_element_address);
602 for (size_t i = 0; i < sizeof(int64_t); i++) {
603 base[i] = static_cast<int8_t>(initial_value);
604 }
605 break;
606 }
607 case kRefNull:
608 case kRef:
609 if constexpr (kTaggedSize == 4) {
610 int32_t* base = reinterpret_cast<int32_t*>(initial_element_address);
611 base[0] = base[1] = static_cast<int32_t>(initial_value);
612 } else {
613 // We use WriteUnalignedValue; see above.
614 base::WriteUnalignedValue(
615 reinterpret_cast<Address>(initial_element_address), initial_value);
616 }
617 break;
618 case kS128:
619 case kRtt:
620 case kVoid:
621 case kBottom:
622 UNREACHABLE();
623 }
624
625 int bytes_already_set = sizeof(int64_t);
626
627 while (bytes_already_set * 2 <= bytes_to_set) {
628 std::memcpy(initial_element_address + bytes_already_set,
629 initial_element_address, bytes_already_set);
630 bytes_already_set *= 2;
631 }
632
633 if (bytes_already_set < bytes_to_set) {
634 std::memcpy(initial_element_address + bytes_already_set,
635 initial_element_address, bytes_to_set - bytes_already_set);
636 }
637
638 if (emit_write_barrier) {
639 DCHECK(type.is_reference());
640 Tagged<WasmArray> array = WasmArray::cast(Tagged<Object>(raw_array));
641 Isolate* isolate = array->GetIsolate();
642 ObjectSlot start(reinterpret_cast<Address>(initial_element_address));
643 ObjectSlot end(
644 reinterpret_cast<Address>(initial_element_address + bytes_to_set));
645 isolate->heap()->WriteBarrierForRange(array, start, end);
646 }
647}
648
649double flat_string_to_f64(Address string_address) {
650 Tagged<String> s = String::cast(Tagged<Object>(string_address));
651 return FlatStringToDouble(s, ALLOW_TRAILING_JUNK,
652 std::numeric_limits<double>::quiet_NaN());
653}
654
655void sync_stack_limit(Isolate* isolate) {
656 DisallowGarbageCollection no_gc;
657
658 isolate->SyncStackLimit();
659}
660
661intptr_t switch_to_the_central_stack(Isolate* isolate, uintptr_t current_sp) {
662 ThreadLocalTop* thread_local_top = isolate->thread_local_top();
663 StackGuard* stack_guard = isolate->stack_guard();
664
665 auto secondary_stack_limit = stack_guard->real_jslimit();
666
667 stack_guard->SetStackLimitForStackSwitching(
668 thread_local_top->central_stack_limit_);
669
670 thread_local_top->secondary_stack_limit_ = secondary_stack_limit;
671 thread_local_top->secondary_stack_sp_ = current_sp;
672 thread_local_top->is_on_central_stack_flag_ = true;
673
674 auto counter = isolate->wasm_switch_to_the_central_stack_counter();
675 isolate->set_wasm_switch_to_the_central_stack_counter(counter + 1);
676
677 return thread_local_top->central_stack_sp_;
678}
679
680void switch_from_the_central_stack(Isolate* isolate) {
681 ThreadLocalTop* thread_local_top = isolate->thread_local_top();
682 CHECK_NE(thread_local_top->secondary_stack_sp_, 0);
683 CHECK_NE(thread_local_top->secondary_stack_limit_, 0);
684
685 auto secondary_stack_limit = thread_local_top->secondary_stack_limit_;
686 thread_local_top->secondary_stack_limit_ = 0;
687 thread_local_top->secondary_stack_sp_ = 0;
688 thread_local_top->is_on_central_stack_flag_ = false;
689
690 StackGuard* stack_guard = isolate->stack_guard();
691 stack_guard->SetStackLimitForStackSwitching(secondary_stack_limit);
692}
693
694intptr_t switch_to_the_central_stack_for_js(Address raw_receiver,
695 uintptr_t* stack_limit_slot) {
696 Tagged<JSReceiver> receiver = JSReceiver::cast(Tagged<Object>(raw_receiver));
697 Isolate* isolate = receiver->GetIsolate();
698 // Set the suspender's {has_js_frames} field. The suspender contains JS
699 // frames iff it is currently on the central stack.
700 // The wasm-to-js wrapper checks this field when calling a suspending import
701 // and traps if the stack contains JS frames.
702 auto active_suspender =
703 WasmSuspenderObject::cast(isolate->root(RootIndex::kActiveSuspender));
704 active_suspender->set_has_js_frames(1);
705 ThreadLocalTop* thread_local_top = isolate->thread_local_top();
706 StackGuard* stack_guard = isolate->stack_guard();
707 *stack_limit_slot = stack_guard->real_jslimit();
708 stack_guard->SetStackLimitForStackSwitching(
709 thread_local_top->central_stack_limit_);
710 thread_local_top->is_on_central_stack_flag_ = true;
711 return thread_local_top->central_stack_sp_;
712}
713
714void switch_from_the_central_stack_for_js(Address raw_receiver,
715 uintptr_t stack_limit) {
716 Tagged<JSReceiver> receiver = JSReceiver::cast(Tagged<Object>(raw_receiver));
717 Isolate* isolate = receiver->GetIsolate();
718 // The stack only contains wasm frames after this JS call.
719 auto active_suspender =
720 WasmSuspenderObject::cast(isolate->root(RootIndex::kActiveSuspender));
721 active_suspender->set_has_js_frames(0);
722 ThreadLocalTop* thread_local_top = isolate->thread_local_top();
723 thread_local_top->is_on_central_stack_flag_ = false;
724 StackGuard* stack_guard = isolate->stack_guard();
725 stack_guard->SetStackLimitForStackSwitching(stack_limit);
726}
727
728} // namespace v8::internal::wasm
